website_summaries.verdict: A heavy, sturdy and well-made winter boot that has some inconsistencies when it comes to size.
pros: Customers rave about the durability, stylish look, and warm and comfortable design of these boots
They also stand out for being easy to take on and off, and being easy to adjust once they're on
cons: A few think these are too bulky-looking, and there are some inconsistencies in sizing (some say they run large while others feel they run small)

customer_reviews.title: Warm boots with a little fixing
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't give these 5 stars because of two problems, both can be overcome, but that should not necessary There is no insole inside this boot, the felt inserts are right on the bumpy rubber sole. I fixed this by buying some of the gel inserts, but don't feel this should be necessary in a new product. The fit seemed to me to be a little large, after a little trial and error I discovered they were more comfortable if the strap across the front is a little loose, when pulled tight it cuts into my ankles. They do keep my feet warm!
customer_reviews.author: Goldenrodfarm

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is ridiculous
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear between 10.5 and 11 and usually wear a larger boot for thicker socks. I ordered size 12, they came and I thought there was a mistake, they were HUGE! So I sent them back, they don't do half sizes so I ordered a pair of 11s. Got them, tried to put them on and they were so tight, I could barely get them on (and this was with regular socks)! I'm not sure what happned here, if this was a fluke or what but I literally can't even own these because one size won't go on and the next size up falls off my foot if I pick it up. Extremely disappointed in their sizing.
customer_reviews.author: Mike T

customer_reviews.title: Broke the first time I tried to put it on.
customer_reviews.text: The steel “hinge” that’s part of the ankle strap broke literally the first time I tried to put the boot on. I managed to bend it back into place but when I put the other boot on, it looked very strained like it would pop off also. Returning to amazon the same day I got them.
customer_reviews.author: E. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: It keep my feet dry and warm all day( I usually on the route for like 8+ hours a day) and it work great not ...
customer_reviews.text: I am a Rural carrier for post office so winter time I have to walk in deep snow to go to people house to delver packages and I use to own $300 boots and the bottom came off because of the suction from walking on slow and try to pull your feet up so I bought this one and give it a try.It keep my feet dry and warm all day( I usually on the route for like 8+ hours a day) and it work great not too heavy but well made.
customer_reviews.author: Pikachu

customer_reviews.title: Super disappointed
customer_reviews.text: These boots do not handle winter weather well. Bought to use outside briefly twice/ day. We’ve had a lot of times this year where snow begins to melt then refreezes. These boots are not water resistant at all- so at the slightest moisture level they became saturated and haven’t been totally dry for months- despite leaving them in front of heat source whenever not in use. Trying to take out, dry & then replace the liners is very difficult and time consuming. After removing them once they never fully went back in right. I was looking for a weather resistant, warm winter boot and this was a big disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: that13girl

customer_reviews.title: Great in the snow
customer_reviews.text: Got these 2 days before 16" of snow fell and the temps went to near zero (F). I shoveled for about 2 1/2 hours and they kept me warm and dry. Traction was great and there was a small layer of crusty ice below the snow. The fit was just right. I wear a 10 1/2 E (wide) and bought the size 11. These are a perfect fit for my feet. They are also easy on and off with just one strap and a slider on each boot. They appear to be high quality - I'll add something the end of the winter or next season if there is any unusual wear.
customer_reviews.author: Western-NY

customer_reviews.title: Feels narrow but broke in fine after a few hours.
customer_reviews.text: Looks good and well built not cheap at all runs narrow. I wear a 10-10 1/2 usually but bought 11 because I got these for snowmobiling and plan on wearing thick socks. When I first tried them on I was worried they would be uncomfortable because of how tight they fit on the sides of my feet. I got them on with regular and wool socks on and they were comfortable the whole four days I had them on. -40 is a bit of a stretch I was in single digit temperatures and my toes did get cold eventually but I had plenty of toe room to slide in a couple hand warmers and all was good.
customer_reviews.author: Keepjeepn1

customer_reviews.title: Kamik Mens winter snow boots !!! Great Fit ! Awesome U.S.A.  made snow boot!!!
customer_reviews.text: wow nice boots fit perfect ! I was a little worried I ordered my normal size of 11 and they fit just right I wouldn't say larger . My favorite part about them is made in U.S.A , That may be why they fit so well . I originally ordered some sorel brand winter boots and I ordered an 11.5 1/2 size larger than my norm however they are heading back as we speak way too small couldn't even begin to get them on maybe because they are made in China ? anyway my new USA made Kamiks are awesome If they can keep me warm anywhere near the -40 * they say I'm a happy customer !!!
customer_reviews.author: Alison

customer_reviews.title: Second time's the charm
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these after returning a pair in size 12 that broke. This pair held up fine to a stubborn New England winter. It was nice finally having boots that didn't take a long time to seal up, and that kept the snow out of my socks when stepping into the deep banks the plows kept throwing up in my driveway. They seem to run a size small, so consider 1 size larger than normal (I ordered 13 for my size 12 flippers). They're not sexy, but they work well, and the liners keep your tootsies warm, even when the puppy wants to go out at 3:00 AM during a blizzard.
customer_reviews.author: The RoadWarrior

customer_reviews.title: Not bad at all
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned with some of the reviews and pics. I decided to give it a try. I was sure to give them a good look over for any poor stitching or to see they were worn and sent back to Amazon. All checked out and I was surprised to see the soles were thicker rubber and more robust than my old pair of Sorel's when they were new. These are a an inch shorter on the calf but it's still a god height. I found the size/fit to be on the small side but again it's still ok. I'm happy so far and Imay give an update after some use.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Still a great boot. Just order a couple sizes bigger then ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a size 12 . I wear a size 10 1/2 normally but because I have a problem with my feet I need to wear a larger shoe . These fit tight but are functional. I was hoping they would be a little larger so I could wear a heavier sock but not sure I can do that. Still a great boot . Just order a couple sizes bigger then you wear . If I had ordered a 10 1/2 I wouldn't have been able to wear them.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Leaks like a sieve.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in September in advance of a sailing trip we had planned for November in Antarctic waters. Today i wore them for the first time to go ashore on a Zodiac. Stepped in 6 inches of water, and I might as well have been bare footed. The boots leaked like a sieve. Thankfully the ship had extra boots I can use the rest of the trip. I want my money back.
customer_reviews.author: RBH

customer_reviews.title: Serviceable, with room to improve.
customer_reviews.text: Have not given these an extensive test yet. Still early in the season. Seem to be well made. For me the boots were a tad too snug in the mid foot and a tad too wide in the toe and heel. Good enough for occasional use boots; I'll keep them. I think the outer sole is probably a bit hard and rigid for traction on ice. Have not had occasion to try it yet, and even if true that is pretty much always true of boots; but if I could invent the perfect winter boot it would grip a little more dynamically.
customer_reviews.author: Arlan Purdy

customer_reviews.title: Not Waterproof
customer_reviews.text: These boots work great in the regular snow. I snowblowed and they kept my feet dry and warm. I ended up wearing them ice fishing where there was slush on the ice and the boots were not waterproof like the advertisement claimed. My whole feet were wet and cold the entire time I was out there. So depending what you need them for I recommend you look at other boots if you need a 100% waterproof boot. These were only waterproof on the bottom portion of the boot.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney and Greg

customer_reviews.title: Great cold weather snow boots. Fits true to size. Warm.
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my husband and he loves them. They fit true to size - he wears size 13 in boots and these in size 13 fit perfect. Very warm! He was outside for a long time, 8 degrees F, shoveling and some yard work, lots of snow, and his feet were warm and dry the whole time. Good sturdy sole, non slip. I have two different Kamik boots - I highly recommend this brand and definitely recommend these men's boots.
customer_reviews.author: Musicbookfan

customer_reviews.title: Good quality snow and rain boots
customer_reviews.text: Classic style and good looks. Kept my active, snow and mud stomping sons feet dry and warm. Well made, I have high hopes they'll actually last til he outgrows them. The drawstring at the top allows the fit to be adjusted to keep out snow or water but still be super easy on and off. Also, the Velcro strap eliminates the time consuming need to lace up the boots. They are quick off and on. No more arguments from son that it takes too long to put on his boots before he goes outside. He likes them so he wears them, so happy mom.
customer_reviews.author: docnred

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow and seller didn't cover return shipping costs :(
customer_reviews.text: Boots ran a little bit large, but the bigger problem was how narrow they were, hurting my husband's feet. We had to return them and the seller that we purchased them from (even though it was through Prime), did not cover the shipping costs so we're out $21 for that! I hope they'll at least honor the return and refund us the full amount, but I'm nervous about that happening!
customer_reviews.author: mommyreader

customer_reviews.title: NARROW.
customer_reviews.text: This boot is narrow. Really narrow and I have narrow feet. The arch is really high as well, not super bad but noticeable. The boots soles seem high as well, thick. Like 2 inches off the ground. Boot goes up above mid calf, so 3/4 calf. They just arrived so we will see how they break in. Definitely go a full size bigger, no matter what. I went a half size bcz I won't be wearing thick socks, should have went full size. Good thing im just using these to shovel the driveway and occasionally sled with the kids.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great Big Boot, Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for what it is: A big , warm, clunky, easy to get on, high boot. Great for: Cold weather Building a snowman Ice fishing Walking the dog Deep snow Not good for: Long hikes Snow shoeing Ankle support Agility
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Leyda

customer_reviews.title: Warm
customer_reviews.text: These are my first official winter boots, therefore my evaluation may be skewed. They are stiff. Difficult to drive the car. Snug on the outer aspect of my little toe, but that may get better as I wear them. The foot felt will compress and I believe that I shall buy some sort of cushion for it. They are very warm. They are easy to put on, but not as easy to take off.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Owens

customer_reviews.title: Can't get him to stop wearing them, and it is summer.
customer_reviews.text: My SO has "never had winter boots that fit so well, and feel so good". He is disabled and I usually have to put any footwear on and off of him. He can slip these on himself and I don't even have to put the ice grippers on them. Hold up well so far and clean off nicely too. I caught him the other day wearing them outside, in 90 degree weather. I had been asleep and he didn't want to wake me to put his shoes on.
customer_reviews.author: N Olson

customer_reviews.title: top notch quality & comfort
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my grandson and he reports size accuracy, comfort & warmth. He says the ankle strap keeps his foot from sliding up & down like most pull on boots, and at 12 years old, he wants boots he can just step into & go. The shaft stays upright, not floppy. The liner is warm but not as heavy as felt-packs. The sole is flexible, with aggressive grip & traction. The velcro ankle strap can be loosened if needed to slide feet in with ease, then snug for a secure fit. The construction is solid and sure to be durable. Pricey for a growing boy, but a good price for such quality. And good protection for sledding & snowmobile riding.
customer_reviews.author: kathos

customer_reviews.title: I LIKE THESE BOOTS
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of Sorel's . The liners that are available are not as good as the original and the same price as these boots. I really like these boots. I live-in Fargo ND and we have had cold and lots of snow. I like these boots real well.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Winter Boots
customer_reviews.text: I use these primarily when I'm clearing snow from my driveway and sidewalks. They are easy to put on and take off and they are warm, certainly warm enough for what I use them for. Clearing snow takes me anywhere from 1 to 2 hours and my feet stay warm. Winters here typically see temperatures from -20 degrees F to +20 degrees F. When it snows it's usually between 0 and 20 degrees F. I'm happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Woodward

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Warm...just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: After winters of having wet socks in the cold Michigan winters, I finally broke down and bought a set of boots that would keep my feet warm and dry while cleaning the snow. I had plenty of opportunities to use them over the past winter and these boots performed admirably. I even wore them around while running errands and they were comfortable to walk around the store. The only thing is they do keep your feet warm, so keep that in mind if just wearing them around town. I was not familiar with the Kamik brand before buying the boots and went solely off the reviews to make my decision. I'm very happy I did.
customer_reviews.author: Rico Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: These are the best boots for occasional trips out in the snow
customer_reviews.text: These are the best boots for occasional trips out in the snow. They are tall so they let you walk in deep snow, but you don't have to go through the hassle of tying laces and untying them while dressed in cold weather gear. I've never had to wear them more than a few hours at a time, but while they are on my feet they are some of the warmest cover I've ever worn. Highly recommend them. This will be my third winter with them, and I'm kinda excited to wear them again. Bring it Mother Nature!
customer_reviews.author: The Strassa of Luffle

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with these boots
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for snow removal duties. They were only worn for one snow storm so far and I really liked them. They kept dry, warm and comfortable for several hours of trudging through 9 inches of heavy, wet snow while shoveling and snow throwing. They fit well and are easy to get on and off. They might not be ideal for walking or hiking distances, but they served very well for the reason they were purchased. I did not expect much for less than fifty bucks, but I am very pleased so far.
customer_reviews.author: David H

customer_reviews.title: The perfect Winter Boot
customer_reviews.text: My second pair ....don't be fooled (if it doesn't say Greenbay 4 ) its not the same boot ! I depend on these boots for almost the entire winter. Don't care if the snow is 5' deep, wet or dry, 25 below, my feet are always comfortable ! The only improvement I can suggest would be a pair of clip on spikes for solid ice !
customer_reviews.author: Durfee / Wlphe

customer_reviews.title: These boots suck..
customer_reviews.text: These boots suck... I took them out multiple times in very normal snow conditions and my feet got wet every time. They are going back asap.
customer_reviews.author: Keith  Long

customer_reviews.title: Same Boot 15 Years Later
customer_reviews.text: Usually a 12 fits me pretty tight and a 13 is too large. The size 12 fit perfectly. I had a pair of these that I bought about 15 years ago that worked great. Super warm. I used them as my winter snow boots. The felt lining wore out after 15 years so I purchased a new pair. It was almost the same price to purchase new as replace the felt after shipping. The new boots are identical to the pair I had purchased 15 years ago. Hopefully these will last just as long.
customer_reviews.author: NY Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not 100% waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I got the boots based on the reviews,I do a lot of ice fishing .There was a lot of snow and slush this winter,the second day I wore these boots,they got a lot of water inside,after a day on the ice my socks were soaked.Very disappointed,as I was not walking with them in pools of water,but even if I did,they are advertised as 100% waterproof,and they are definitely not.I would not recommend the boots(at least not for ice fishing,when you're out in the cold you rely on every piece of gear you have,this one has failed me)
customer_reviews.author: 4Flo

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING BOOT
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these boots for my husband 1/2 bigger than his normal shoe size because he has a wide foot. They fit perfectly. They keep his feet warm and dry, but not overly warm (his feet do not sweat in these boots). He has worked out in the yard in the rain and cold and he is VERY satisfied with them and he does not say that often about a product. He would buy another pair anytime. He likes the convenience of the slip on and off and with the Velcro strap they do not slip off when walking or working. The non-skid sole was an added plus when he had to go on the roof in the rain.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah W.

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these mainly for use when snow blowing the driveway. I bought a size up so I could easily wear regular socks and a pair of wool socks on those really cold days and not cut off circulation to my feet. They fit great with or without doubling up on socks. Great tread to keep you vertical as well! Quality seems to be great, though I have only worn them a handful of times I expect to be wearing them for many winter seasons.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: ***UPDATED REVIEW***
customer_reviews.text: I always wear a 10M. In EVERY shoe. But these feel REALLY tight in the toebox - like my toes are squished together. Even with a thin pair of socks. First time this has ever happened. ***UPDATE*** I wore these a total of four times, never in the snow, just in the cold and on pavement. All I can say is they became MORE uncomfortable with each subsequent wearing. I have downgraded this from three stars to one. I plan on replacing these with another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They are very warm and comfortable. They are nice and light and easy to ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for ice fishing. I have neuropathy in my feet so I needed a very warm boot. They are very warm and comfortable. They are nice and light and easy to walk in with good traction. They are also easy to put on and take off. These boots will keep your feet dry unless slush goes over the seam from bottom just below ankle. Other than that I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Jlvbert

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: I have 6 kids, and have purchased these boots every year since they were little. They fit great, easy to get on and off, and keep their feet warm in Michigan’s cold winter months. The added bonus of having rubber around the bottom and toe box is that when it is wet out, their feet stay dry. Each pair has made it through 2-3 kids before needing to be replaced, so great quality for the price point.
customer_reviews.author: DonnaB6

customer_reviews.title: Pay up, or Pay down away from these.
customer_reviews.text: To start, I have a blood circulation condition so my hands and feet tend to be colder more often. That said, I tried these and they are a far cry from listed temperature ratings. I live in Michigan and even above 20degrees I was feeling the cold. I'll be keeping them for now, but upgrading my arctic sock game to offset the boots. I'd advise going much higher to a better boot, or going down and getting better socks
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Ensing II

customer_reviews.title: If you measure your feet using the guide then you should be good!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THESE BOOTS! Now let me first preface this by saying that I do not live in an area where I would need to wear snow boots as part of my day to day. I'm not sure that these are the boots for that. But if you are heading to the snow a few times a year, these are perfect. Use the size guide to measure your foot before you choose a size. I found them to be comfortable out of the box. I wore them all day for 3 or 4 days straight in all types of snow and came home with feet that were both warm and dry.
customer_reviews.author: Tony M.

customer_reviews.title: Kept my feet dry and warm in Utah
customer_reviews.text: Got these for the sole purpose of using them on my winter trip to Utah. They were the only boots (besides my ski boots) that I wore. Love how you can slip them off easily, great for airport security checks. Comfortable enough to walk long distances in. Slopped through slushy snow without getting wet. Did not slip and fall. Lightweight too.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Skier-man

customer_reviews.title: Leaked
customer_reviews.text: I bought two pairs of Kamik boots. These and the NationPlus Snow boots. I subjected them both to the same test which was to submerge them in water at least one inch above the seam between the rubber bottom and the upper material for one hour. These leaked and the NationPlus boots did not. I kept the NationPlus and returned these.
customer_reviews.author: GaryS1964

customer_reviews.title: Great boots at great price!
customer_reviews.text: Great boots! My husband was really pleased with these. They are really easy to put on and fairly easy to take off and keeps you really warm. The fit is somewhat snug but the next size up would be too big. If you wear a half size you could probably go to the next full size but if you wear a full size you are probably ok buying your regular size as there is a chance the size up would be too big. Great boots and a great price and they are tall enough to keep the snow out. He was stopped in a store by someone commenting on how nice his boots were.
customer_reviews.author: DJS

customer_reviews.title: easy to put on & take off
customer_reviews.text: Light, easy to put on & take off. I got these for work because my toes have nerve damage from last winter so they are very sensitive to cold now. Only been down into the high 20* so far and they worked great and light enough to wear at work for 10+ hours a day.
customer_reviews.author: A. Rich, TN

customer_reviews.title: I have wide feet and hoped 11 would work for ...
customer_reviews.text: I have wide feet and hoped 11 would work for a 10 E+; well it did to some extent. But with heavy socks, there is not much room left. Plus, since there is no side zipper or front laces, very difficult to get on and off. Boot comes up the calf very high and ended up bruising my skin just below the knee. On the positive, boot is very warn in single-digit and teen F. temps. Last time I'll buy this type of boot, especially since few boot makers offer wide, extra wide sizes;at lease here on Amazon. I'll be looking for front laces or side zippers.
customer_reviews.author: Mark1City

customer_reviews.title: A little tighter than expected
customer_reviews.text: Not that there is anything wrong with this - but I wanted to state that there is no room at all for thick socks in these boots. They fit snug. They may loosen up with wear - and they are not too tight - but they are surprisingly snug. Don't think you will have room for an extra pair of socks when you receive these.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: unfortunate seam issue.
customer_reviews.text: The seam on top of my left boot split open upon wearing these outside for the first time. The good thing here is customer service from Kamik has been great. I am replacing these with another Kamik boot. They were warm in the snow. It might have been a different story if the snow had more water content. One thing you should consider, if you are wearing these, get a sock that will stay up higher than the boot, the liner is a little uncomfortable if it's against your skin, this isn't an issue if you tuck your pants into the boot.
customer_reviews.author: Brian J. Wing

customer_reviews.title: A lot of boot for the money
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a second pair for my husband after he tried to swipe the pair i bought for our son. For the money these are a great pair of boots. They are sturdy yet comfortable and with a decent sock are very warm. My husband wore them snowmobiling all day and both boys have done a lot shoveling in them and are very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: JoEllen

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: Love how easy these are to put on/take off, the main reason I got them. I used to wear Sorels but got so frustrated putting them on, all those laces drove me nuts. These are so simple to put on I am outside doing my thing in no time. They seem good quality, too. So far, warm and dry. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Steve C.

customer_reviews.title: Not the best but does the job reasonably ok
customer_reviews.text: The boot fit fine, I'm an 11 1/2 but I got a 12 cause I was gonna be wearing thick socks. The quality is ok to an extent. The top of the boot was so stiff and ta hard to tighten up with the string. It opened up as I walked through the snow and got my socks all wet after a while. When I first tried them on, I pulled the strap to Velcro and secure it and the little metal loop bent and came off. Luckily I had pliers but that was a big fail. I wasn't too happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro R.

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong buying Kamik.
customer_reviews.text: Love Kamik boots for the kids. They are the only boots we have bought for our kids. Love that you can pull out the felts and either throw them in the dryer or on the boot drier if the kids get them wet. They are warm and last forever. When my kids grow out of a pair, I give them to my younger nephews to wear.
customer_reviews.author: The Lade's

customer_reviews.title: Good boots
customer_reviews.text: These boots served my family well during our trip to northern Norway, in the arctic circle. But they did not help us find the Aurora Borealis which was what we were hoping for. They did keep our feet comfortable and warm while standing around in the snow and wind for hours hoping for a break in the clouds. And they also work well for shoveling the driveway at home.
customer_reviews.author: J. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Quality Boots
customer_reviews.text: Minnesotan here - been wearing Kamik boots for 20+ years. My first pair lasted 10 years - when the inserts wore out, I called Kamik and they sent me new oneS. These are for my husband. Upon arrival, I can see that they are of the same great quality as the women’s boots I’ve purchased. My husband is very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: S. Swan

customer_reviews.title: but given he is growing and boots are better bigger than smaller
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my 12-year old son whose feet are growing fast. He usually wears size 8.5, but given he is growing and boots are better bigger than smaller, I bought him size 9. He says they fit well. He had a similar pair before, and they were great in snow. I expect the new pair will work fine, too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Snow biking shoes.
customer_reviews.text: I got these specifically for riding a fat bike in the snow. I have used these on flat pedals. They are warm and the height negates the need for gaiters. They fit as expected, I'm a perfect size 11. They have enough support for short hikes though I would not recommend them for longer hikes. They work well for kicking around, shoveling snow and are great for snow biking.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael

customer_reviews.title: Just Right
customer_reviews.text: We live in snow country, rural. My husband needed a pair of boots that are warm, slip on easily, waterproof. uses them for snow blowing and other outside winter work. They were a bit snug in forefoot at first, but conformed to fit with a short amount of wear. He really loves them.
customer_reviews.author: snodreamin

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculously narrow
customer_reviews.text: These seem true to size lengthwise. I ordered a half size up and they're a bit too long but WAY too narrow, like painful foot pinching narrow. Who has feet like this? If your feet are shaped like carrots this is the boot for you.

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: Got the boots yesterday, I have foot problems and can't wear anything except gym shoes. I've broke my foot and ankle years ago, and if left me with no ability to wear stiff shoes without extreme pain. I wore the boots yesterday all day, i can't believe they are this comfortable, just great. quality, fit and finish of the boots is very top notch, this may be in my top three all time of best things i ever bought on amazon. Love it
customer_reviews.author: MITCHELL A. DAVIS

customer_reviews.title: Before you buy read this
customer_reviews.text: These are good but you absolutely must buy inserts like Dr. Scholls or your ankle bone will very painfully hit the rigid side protrusion. Also, the insulation insert is not what I would call made to fit exactly the size of your feet. As a result one foot may be fine and the other not. Fortuneatly they are removable. Remember those inserts or you won't be able to wear them.
customer_reviews.author: Vanns40

customer_reviews.title: go up a size
customer_reviews.text: i wear size 12 normally, i ordered a size 13, and its a perfect fit with warm socks...12 would have been too tight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: Awesome boots. Its -20F outside and my feet were WARM. I sprayed 3 coats of 3m waterproofer spray, and tested them in my bathtub, and they were definitely waterproof. Ordered 1 size bigger than I normally wear, so I could wear winter socks, but the boots fit perfectly, and they are so warm that winter socks were completely unnecessary. These are way better than my columbia boots at 5x the price.
customer_reviews.author: Alison

customer_reviews.title: Super awesome
customer_reviews.text: Toasty warm and super comfortable. I have very wide feet, these fit perfectly. I ordered one size larger. Knee deep in snow all day and these puppies shined. Feet dry and warm. Highly recommend. I really like the removable liners that you can wash. So awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Laughably bad fit!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how these boots were sized, they are ridiculously huge - not 2 pairs of extra thick socks huge - like 2 or 3 full sizes too big. The boot upper is also strangely oversized, they might fit if my ankles and calves were the same diameter as my thigh. These boots essentially fell off my feet everytime I moved. Like other reviewers, I had the same problem of the strap hardware bending and slipping out of position. Don't buy these boots, unless you need a ridiculous clown shoe alternative for snow..
customer_reviews.author: Jon Friedmeyer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Worth The Price
customer_reviews.text: These boots are perfect for me, I finally got to use them with Stella passing through PA. Having a bad back, being able to slip them on and off is perfect, and the velcro straps I have adjusted just right for me. With 24 inches of snow and extreme cold, my feet were nice and warm. While this isn't the best pair of boots I've owned, they are pretty darn close. Hope to get many years out of these boots.
customer_reviews.author: George Miller

customer_reviews.title: Not for wide feet. Maybe?, I still need a 50m. break-in.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. The one strap system is not aligned when tightening. The retention ring is pointed too far down towards the toe. When tightened, the velcro system runs out of male to female overlap. By spring I'll probably put them on like overgrown slippers, no tightening just a warm foot glove. ps.they are lite. 50/50, your choice. Good price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy if you have wide feet
customer_reviews.text: I wear size 15 wide but can usually get away with standard size. Not with this boot. I wore it for less than two minutes and the pain was strong enough that I think I actually bruised my foot because my sides hurt for over an hour thereafter. Quickly returned, will look for a wider boot.
customer_reviews.author: anthonyjh21

customer_reviews.title: Good boots
customer_reviews.text: The nylon upper breathes very well, gets rid of excess moisture[sweat] better than any pack boots I've ever owned. I've been buying Kamik's Zylex liners for several years for other boots, they hold up well. Very happy with these.

customer_reviews.title: Warm and Dry Boots
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots for my husband for Christmas and they have worked really well! His feet stay dry and warm while he's out in the snow, weather he's walking around or shoveling his feet stay dry. He also loves that he doesn't have laces that he has to lace up, it's convenient and it also helps keep the snow out. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Severson

customer_reviews.title: Nice Boot Quality and Durable
customer_reviews.text: Skeptical on the size as with buying any clothing etc online. I can wear 10-11 all depends on shoe type and manufacturer. I went with the reviews and stayed with the "10" and they fit nicely! No need for thick socks, but they are a bit narrow at first. I recommend breaking them in by wearing for a few hours a day to seat the insert to your foot/feet. Getting off the first time was a challenge but after a few times they came off easily without a struggle. They certainly will keep your feet warm!
customer_reviews.author: USnTHEM

customer_reviews.title: Good boot for warmth when you have to be out in the weather.
customer_reviews.text: The soul is very minimal. You can feel almost everything you walk on through the boot. Thinking a gel insole would greatly reduce this effect. The boots are very warm and a welcome addition to my snow blower outfit.
customer_reviews.author: ablur

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic boots for the price
customer_reviews.text: I'm big into ice fishing and my friends all buy $200-400 boots to go out. Mine keep up perfect with then and keep me warm even when. I'm just sitting. They're comfortable to walk in as well for being so high on the leg.
customer_reviews.author: SegaNeptune

customer_reviews.title: Great quality boots!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing boots. Can’t believe I bought it for $85 and now they’re $45. Definitely recommended I like that they’re quick to put on, comfy, stay warm and have the extra tight Velcro straps on the bottom. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur P

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: They are like arctic slip on slippers. We just had the blizzard in New Jersey with lots of snow and sub zero temperatures and these boots were great. I felt no cold while I kicked away the snow off the steps. The size was perfect. I am a 11.5 3E. I ordered 12. Best snow boots I've ever had!
customer_reviews.author: Curtis H.

customer_reviews.title: Toasty warm
customer_reviews.text: My husband didn't like the style of these boots (so much for a surprise) so I was going to return them, but then I tried them on myself and decided that I would keep them for myself! Just in time for a huge snowstorm with weeks of subzero temps.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I work outdoors and these boots are comfortable and warm
customer_reviews.text: I work outdoors and these boots are comfortable and warm. I use to have to wear two pair of sox plus another pair of insulated sox on top of them and still couldn't keep my feet warm. These keep my feet not only warm but dry as well. Well worth the price, I wish I had found these sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: My husband loves these boots. I got them as ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these boots. I got them as a gift for him for Christmas and it snowed that day so he put them to immediate use. they are really warm and the drawstring at the top keeps the snow out. He loves them. Time will tell if they hold up but they appear to be really well made.
customer_reviews.author: Amy P.

customer_reviews.title: Great Boot at Great Price
customer_reviews.text: These boots were awesome. I wore them to South Lake Tahoe and the average temp was 41 degrees. My feet stayed warm and dry the whole time. They worked great especially when I would sink two or three feet into the snow, never once did I worry about getting wet. They held up nice and also gave me enough grip to walk on some ice. Overall great boot and great price
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Love those Kamiks
customer_reviews.text: Kamik winter boots are by far our favorite! These exact boots are made with exceptional quality...well worth the price you pay. They last forever. If you are buying Kamiks for a kid or teenager, they will outgrow them before they wear out...excellent for hand-me-downs. One year I went cheap and bought some off-brand at a department store; will NEVER do that again. The off-brand started coming apart after the second or third wear on my son. These Kamiks hold up to even the toughest kiddo. I know...my son is one of them! :0) There is only one negative I can think of.....the boots are a bit heavy. Other than that, they are 5 stars in our book!
customer_reviews.author: wifeandmomfromoh

customer_reviews.title: Okay for an inexpensive cold weather boot.
customer_reviews.text: I have another pair of cold weather boots, rated to -20F. They do not have a liner and they do a better job than these boots which claim a rating of -40F. Not bad for the price, but definitely not what they claim. MAYBE -5 to -10F and the liner might work. Don't know.
customer_reviews.author: Publius

customer_reviews.title: Great boots but .......
customer_reviews.text: My husband had a pair for many years. Great boots. He needed a new pair so we ordered them in the same size he had before. No good. Too short and narrow in the point. He had to go up a size. For the rest they seem to be excellent. Time will tell if they will last as long as the previous pair.
customer_reviews.author: LI shopper

customer_reviews.title: Will Do The Job, Hopefully
customer_reviews.text: Needed a plain winter boot for shoveling snow this winter. This is nothing fancy and seems to fit on the small side. I can’t say if it is really waterproof and how warm they will be as I haven’t worn them yet for a snow storm. Hopefully they will do the job when we have major snow storms this winter but I’m really hoping they just sit in the closet all winter 🥶
customer_reviews.author: Tammi

customer_reviews.title: Boots have been great! So easy to put on and take off ...
customer_reviews.text: Boots have been great! So easy to put on and take off and for me with all the extra attire on to stay warm and a not so healthy back that’s a big help
customer_reviews.author: Dave W.

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: The draw strap is useless, does not tighten down enough to make any difference. The boots had been purchased before me because the buckle the strap goes through was damaged. It was 30 degrees out tonight and I had the boots on for 1.5 hour and my toes are frozen. They are not comfortable to stand in or walk in for even a short amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome boots
customer_reviews.text: The boots feel like they are made with quality products. They were just a little small in size but nothing enough to drop them in rating. I'm keeping it at 5 stars. Time will tell if they can pass the abuse they will receive when I start using them every day so I will post more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: CJ Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Warm boot that is easy to take off or put on
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a boot that didn't take too long to put on or take off and this one did both well. It is warm and sides are still flexible which aids in movement. Purchased half size larger than my shoe size.
customer_reviews.author: N. Rauch

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: Been wearing these boots for a couple days here in big bear California been getting alot of snow in the last couple weeks and was looking forward to these things solving my foot problem in the snow. They seem to be well constructed but do you not keep your feet very warm it's only 18° here these are rated for -40 I would expect my feet to be a little more toasty with a couple socks and pants going over the top of the boot
customer_reviews.author: Bret

customer_reviews.title: Missed the return date by 2 weeks, please please extend
customer_reviews.text: My Grandson just tried these on and found them to be too small. he is a typical 13 year old who didn't try them on until he had the need to. We have had a very mild in Winter here in Worcester MA. Unfortunately I miss ed the return date by 14 days. I hope You can give me an extension on the return date. I live on a fixed income and cannot afford to keep these if we have no need for them. Please and thank you Gramma Pam
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Run 2 sizes small, but GREAT boots!
customer_reviews.text: These are great boots, but they run about 2 sizes small. My daughter, who wears a women's 9, needed a MENS 9 in these boots. According to traditional sizing a women's 9 is a men's 7. We ordered 3 pairs before we finally got them big enough to fit. Again, we love these boots (buy them for our kids every year), but order UP! The women's version of these boots has the same sizing problem, as the women's 10 (as big as they go) was still not big enough for my daughter who wears a 9.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Pyatskowit

customer_reviews.title: a bit like trying to pull your feet out of ankle-deep mud ...
customer_reviews.text: They're exceptionally weighty; a bit like trying to pull your feet out of ankle-deep mud at every step. Not at all "as light as helium" as pitched in their description; not even close. I wear 10.5 and the 11's fit as suggested. I can't comment on the water and cold functionality but you're not running for your life in these things unless you run like Frankenstein and that works for you.
customer_reviews.author: oneflashoflight

customer_reviews.title: Tall boots
customer_reviews.text: These boots are pretty tall. Taller than they seemed in the picture. It hasn’t snowed enough yet to put them to use. But they seem like good quality and my son said he liked them.
customer_reviews.author: Heather E.

customer_reviews.title: Snow boots (or boats?)
customer_reviews.text: Great solid design with good traction. My chief complaint is the overall size, especially the top part of the boot which is way too bulky. Maybe they made it like this to fit your pants inside it, but I was hoping to get my baggy snow pants OVER it, not tuck it in.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Warm and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have winter boots from Sorel that provide good traction and keep my feet dry, but my feet get cold after a fairly short time outdoors. These Kamik boots are just as good for traction and dryness, but they are definitely warm. I can "play" in the snow for hours and never feel cold. I bought one full size larger than my normal size to allow for thick wool socks. If I had bought in my usual size they would have been tight with thick socks.
customer_reviews.author: ldolamore

customer_reviews.title: Professional quality extreme weather boots
customer_reviews.text: These are professional quality boots. Made in USA with Canadian sole plate. These have thick felt inner liners and a high boot top. They are rated for 40 below and are very warm. 100% waterproof with tough outer shell and strong treads. These will handle tough Nebraska winters no problem. Couldn't find anything like this in regular shoe stores. Highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Lang

customer_reviews.title: Good boot
customer_reviews.text: Fits great and it keeps my feet warm but I do not like adjustable snow collar. It doesn’t get very tight and if they are tightened, the right boot rubs my leg raw through my jeans when walking. But so far leaving them loose hasn’t been an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I hoped for!
customer_reviews.text: I spent 2 days in temperatures that ranged from 4 degrees to 19 degrees (Fahrenheit) at my 5 acre camp that is covered in snow. The only time my feet weren't in these, they were in a sleeping bag. These boots performed well through both work and hiking around. I stayed dry and warm, and the traction was good in snow and on ice. Can't beat the price! I look forward to facing my first snow storm on the ambulance with these. Bottom line from my end: Give them a try, I hope your experience is as good as mine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the removable liner and the ankle strap
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 9yr old son. We live in Northern MN where the winters can get down to the -40's. Love the removable liner and the ankle strap. He has skinny legs and ankles so other boots just clunk around when he walks- the Kamik strap prevents that. It is a heavier boot, but I'd rather have the weight and not sacrifice the warmth. My husband has been eyeballing these boots since they came out of the box- would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna

customer_reviews.title: Good Snow Boots!
customer_reviews.text: Good Snow Boots! I use them when I ride my motorcycle in temps that are below 40. They work well, especially with good wool/thick cotton socks. They are a little rigid, so shifting gears is difficult. Other than that, they are great.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart @ FFX-LRV

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a size bigger because of some reviews, I’m a 10-10 1/2 in regular sneakers and ordered a size 11 and fits perfect. Only used them twice but so far they are great, very warm and comfortable to be wearing for long periods of time. Will see how long they last, I’ll update if any changes. I would definitely recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Rony R.

customer_reviews.title: Warm, great quality!
customer_reviews.text: My boys love these snow boots. They say they are warm and do a great job keeping the snow out due to the toggle strap closure at the top. Great buy! Very comfortable and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Katy Oliverson

customer_reviews.title: Flawless Fusion of Form and Function
customer_reviews.text: These boots are awesome. The tall profile is like wearing futuristic pirate boots, which in itself is reason enough to buy them, but they are also the best snow boot I've worn at keeping my toes warm. I'll never buy a different pair of winter boots again.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby B.

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE the cushioned sides and waterproofing and warmth of the boots. I dislike the flat un-padded sole but 10 dollar Dr. Scholls arch support fixed that for me, I already had them handy. I would like there to be a wide velcro shin strap to bring the boot walls closer to our shins, but that could also be purchased seperate and isn't exactly needed, though it would look much better.
customer_reviews.author: Antoine Lee Dolliole

customer_reviews.title: NOT WIDE AT ALL, NO OPTION FOR WIDE to order.
customer_reviews.text: Review lied about the toe box being wide. There was no option for a wider shoe. So for those of you who are ordering these because the review SAY they are wide enough,..NOT TRUE.
customer_reviews.author: camogram

product_meta.title: Kamik Men's Greenbay 4 Cold-Weather Boot
product_meta.description:
You'll scoff at wintery weather in this high-tech snow boot from Kamik. Constructed with a lightweight yet durable waterproof nylon shell, the Greenbay 4 features a removable felt liner and a lace-lock snow collar designed to keep warmth in and cold out. Rated to -40° Fahrenheit, the boot has a mid-foot adjustable Velcro closure strap to help keep the foot snug and a thick treaded rubber outsole for traction on slippery, icy surfaces.

Kamik comes from a place of extremes. Where the harshest conditions intersect with some of the most beautiful sights you'll ever see. At Kamik, we make footwear that brings to life our northern origins. Singular. Strong. Simply dependable. We've been doing it for over 100 years. Day after day. 24/7. The result of all this effort: a complete line of outdoor footwear built to deliver superior comfort and reliable protection in the most extreme conditions. We know you wouldn't have it any other way.
feature_bullets: Made in the USA and Imported
8mm Thermal Guard removable liner (100% recycled content) and hook-and-loop strap
